SEARCH
Package src.syncing

Class Network

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
src.syncing.Network
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Client, Server
public abstract class Network extends Thread
Network class that contains all the methods to synchronize the two devices. Extends Thread to be able to run the synchronization in a separate thread.
Author: Marc Proux

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • connect

      public void connect()
      Create a new socket and connect to the other device. Loop until the connection is established. Add a message to the message list to show the connection status.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • resetConnection

      public void resetConnection()
      Reset the connection by closing the socket and the streams.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • close

      public void close()
      Close the socket and the streams. Set the connect boolean to false.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • firstSync

      public abstract void firstSync() throws IOException
      Do the first synchronization between the two devices. During this synchronization, no file is deleted everything is merged.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • syncAndDelete

      public abstract void syncAndDelete() throws IOException
      Do the synchronization between the two devices. During this synchronization, the files deleted on one device are deleted on the other.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • run

      public abstract void run()
      Run the synchronization in a separate thread. Loop until the synchronization is stopped and not execute the synchronization if the sync is false or if the folder to synchronize doesn't exist.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable
      Overrides:
      run in class Thread

      public Object receiveMessage() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Receive a message from the other device by using the ObjectInputStream.
      Returns:
      the message received as an Object.
      Throws:
